group_1.textRight: Sorry, Melissa, but we can't stop here!
Sir Bâtard is waiting for us just ahead!

group_1.textLeft: Y-yes, Father!

group_1.textRight: Let's move it!
The people of Orléans need our help!
Is that... A group of reinforcements on their way@to Orléans?

group_1.textLeft: They appear to be the dauphin's main forces.
When the English siege began,
it seemed it would be only a matter of time@until Orléans fell...
But I'm not so sure about that now.

group_1.textRight: Orléans is the dauphin's last stronghold in France.
If that city were to fall,
much of this country will fall into the hands of the English.

group_1.textLeft: The one behind the English army@is the "traitorous queen", Isabeau.
"A woman shall cause France to be lost,"
"and a virgin shall save it..."
The first part of the prophecy...
About a woman causing France to be lost...
Is already coming true,
thanks to the powers that you granted her, Cube.

group_1.textRight: ...Looks like the English
have already invaded Orléans.

group_1.textLeft: ...How could this have happened?

group_1.textRight: This war's been going for 100 years,@so it's a pretty long story...
But the Treaty of Troyes was a disaster.

group_1.textLeft: The Treaty of Troyes...?

group_1.textRight: Yeah. The agreement was that Isabeau's daughter,@Catherine of Valois,
was gonna marry the King of England,
and then their kid would become the new@King of France.
More or less, Isabeau sold our whole country off@to England,
leaving all of us in the dust.
So now the English army
is walkin' around France like they own the place.
...Damned traitorous queen.@How could she do this?!

group_1.textLeft: ...France is on the brink of destruction.
Will the girl you chose
be able to save the country as the prophecy@foretold?

group_1.textRight: Please don't misinterpret my actions.
If it were simply a matter of saving France@from England,
I wouldn't intervene.
War between you humans is none of my business.

group_1.textLeft: You're the one who sowed the seeds of calamity@in the first place, though...

group_1.textRight: I'm not going to make excuses, but even if she hadn't@made a contract with me,
France and England still would have been hers.

group_1.textLeft: ...What makes you so sure?

group_1.textRight: A long time ago, when I first met Isabeau...
I could tell that she was a very intelligent young@woman with great ambition.
...Who also held tremendous potential@as a Magical Girl.

group_1.textLeft: And so you offered her a contract
which has since brought great misfortune upon@France and England alike...

group_1.textRight: Exactly. I never expected things to turn out like this,@though.
I can't deny that part.
